intro: Orthodon longibracteatus, commonly known as the long-bract orthodon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features elongated bracts that surround its inflorescence, giving it its scientific name. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellowish in color. Orthodon longibracteatus is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
